subject: Nutrition
title: Moderation Not Perfection
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Moderation Not Perfection.

hook.text: Orthorexia is an obsession with eating perfectly. Even healthy eating can become unhealthy.

buildup.text: Rigid food rules create stress, guilt, and social isolationâ€”which also harm your health.

discovery.text: Studies show flexible eaters maintain healthier weights than strict dieters over the long term.

twist.text: Worrying about food raises cortisol, which ironically promotes the fat storage you're trying to avoid.

climax.text: No single meal makes or breaks your health. What matters is the pattern over weeks and months.

punchline.text: Perfection is the enemy of good nutrition.
